intro: Adenophora communis var. denticulata, commonly known as the toothed bellflower, is a perennial herb native to parts of East Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with finely toothed margins. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
